inn1.comm: first ball nips back and strikes the pad, probably too high, it was back pad though and Smith went nowhere with his feet
fuller length but too much so and Smith handsomely clips it off his pads through midwicket, great timing
better length and more off stump, this is just blocked off the inner half of the bat to midwicket
angled in and strikes and pad again, another appeal but this would have gone down leg
good length on off stump, squirted out to backward point
similar delivery, this time dabs in front of point and they take s sharp single

good length, swings away a bit, takes a thin outside edge and caught behind! What a start for Philander, right on the mark, great length, Smith coming forward to play around middle and off stumps but it swung away just enough to take the outside edge and carried low to de Villiers who got down well to take the catch
lovely ball, just outside off, batsman groping for it gets beaten
straighter line, forward comes the batsman and squirts it out to point
foot outside off and left alone
touch fuller, played firmly forward at and played out to point
slightly tighter line, blocked around off stump
back of a length around off stump, Gayle up on his toes to drop this into the covers and they take a sharp single
similar ball, finds the fielder with this back foot dab
well left, it wasn't that far from the off stump but sliding across the leftie who shouldered arms
touch wider and easier to leave this
able to watch another go by outside off, make him play Morne
much better, a thick outside edge playing forward but down in front of second slip
foot wide of off stump, Gayle forward shouldering arms
tighter line, blocked back to the bowler
length on a straighter line, punched from the crease back to the bowler

fuller and touch wider, Gayle tries to drive this and nicks it behind! Loose drive from Gayle, beaten by a bit of away movement and it's a thin edge through to de Villiers. Huge wicket, classic bowling from Big Vern
off stump line, Samuels waits for it and runs it out towards backward point
touch overpitched and Samuels plays a glorious cover drive, timed the pants off this, smashed it past the fielder in the ring, no stopping that, right off the meat
Full sliding across the lefite who shoudlers arms
touch wide and a nice punch off the back foot to finally get Deonarine away, timed wide of cover
shorter ball, the batsman gets into a pickle and gets hit on the body which runs just short of first slip and through the fielder
nastier short ball, very awkwardly fended off, hit on the shoulder in fact, ouch
wider line and now left alone, batsman very grateful for that
back on the off stump, blocked forward into the covers
back of a length, Samuels keeps the bat inside the line as it goes through a foot outside off
just a touch fuller, still left
just wide enough for Samuels to ignore this once more
tighter line and now dropped out towards point
length ball on a similar line, played from the crease out towards cover
fuller length, driven at and finds mid-on, Philander thought he might have snuck one through there
possibly. Back of a length at the body, well played dropping it down on the leg side
shot! A shuffle out of his ground to create a little room to swing through the line of a length ball and times it past mid-off
which way will Morkel go now? Same ball really, just defended this time with the batsman stuck in his crease no doubt expecting a shortie
this one is short but a foot down leg
back on a length on the stumps, little footwork, dabbed into midwicket
slower ball, waited for in the crease and played back up the wicket
nope, full on leg stump, clipped wide of long leg, they charge back for the second and will check upstairs just in case but Deonarine is well back
full at the pads, Samuels misses trying to swing this through the leg side
length ball just outside off, firmly driven at, well timed but only to mid-off
straighter line, driven up to mid-on, decent timing but found the fielder
slightly shorter, waited for and knocked into cover for a sharp single
full length on off stump, waited for and ran out to backward point
straighter line, Deonarine a tad slow coming forward but gets out to defend in the end
full on the stumps, clipped into midwicket, Rossouw gets down but can only parry this away and so they get back for the second
full length outside off, lovely stroke, perfect timing, blasted through cover
much straighter line, tried to be flicked leg side runs off the pad in front of short long leg and they get a leg bye
full on the stumps, blocked back to the bowler
more off stump now, waited for and angled to backward point's right who gets down well to save

back of a length just outside off, Deonarine tries to back to leg and uppercut but get a thick edge to first slip, Amla can only parry it at first slip but de Villiers reacts to take the catch! The 150th ODI wicket for Steyn. The delivery got a bit big on the batsman and he was rather wafting it. Amla had to leap up over his right shoulder to get two hands on it but did so, couldn't cling on but his captain was on hand to mop up
full on off stump, driven up to mid-on
better length, Samuels forward playing slightly across his pad but gets it up to midwicket
length on off stump, punched from the crease to cover
slower ball on off stump, Samuels just about onto it coming forward, rolls this to mid-on
back just outside off, driven again and finds the gap, opening the face nicely to get it past cover, well timed
tighter line, just blocked back to the bowler this time
length a foot outside off, Ramdin tries to stay leg side of it and nudges to point
this nips back, Ramdin shuffles across his stumps and works to square leg
bumper, easily swayed inside the line
slightly tighter line, slightly fuller length, blocked back up the wicket
short ball, tries the hook, there is a deep square out, unconvincing stroke lands well short of the fielder
foot or so wide of off stump, Samuels withdraws the bat inside the line
around the wicket, full length just outside off, played forward into the covers
full on off stump, flicked down to long-on
tossed up a little more, played carefully forward into the covers
tossed up again, Samuels forward inside edging this onto his front pad, it runs up the wicket
wider line, reached out for, nudged to short extra-cover
too full now and wide enough to drive, nicely played and timed past deep cover
back of a length, nips in a little, defended in front of off stump standing tall
fuller, pressed forward into the covers, fielder across quickly to save the single

full length just outside off, Ramdin pokes at it and drags it on! No foot movement, Ramdin trying to run it down to third man, gets there a little too soon - this wicket is a touch slow - he gets a thick inside edge into middle and off stumps
back of a length outside off, new man Carter sways inside the line
full length siding across the left-hander who shoulders arms
shorter, at the body, knocked down a touch awkwardly - yet successfully - into the covers
down the wicket, nicely driven but right back at the bowler, who can't field, so they get a single down to long-on
back on the off stump playing up the wicket
floated up, batsman well forward pressing back to the bowler
more air, driven from just outside off but straight to mid-off
tossed right up, met on the full and flicked out to long-off
a step down the wicket to flick out to long-on once more
length ball slid in at the pads, inside edge onto the pads, runs back up the wicket
full at the off stump, Samuels hanging back, knocks this towards point
almost identical but this somehow Samuels tweaks his ankle and walks away to square leg shaking his right foot, he's in some pain here
back of a length but dragged well outside off, dabbed down to third man
full outside off, wide enough to leave alone
nice bowling, sliding across the left-hander coming forward on off stump and slides past the outside edge
full on the stumps, pushed down the ground to long off
gets into the front foot and drives to cover
driven towards deep-ish mid off
touch short outside off, punched from the back foot to deep cover
full outside off, 117kph, left alone
defended towards mid off, a gentle but accurate over
full outside leg, he comes forward with bat and pad together
worked into the leg side
eased down the ground to long off
over the wicket, full outside off, a strong drive down the ground

he's lofted into the deep again! Came down the pitch, think he was aiming leg side but there was a hint of turn and it took the thick outer part of the bat and flew to long off. Was a very well judged catch as the rope was fairly close. But another (yet another) reckless shot from Samuels
tossed wide outside, slapped through the covers to the sweeper
on off stump, defended to covers
short of a length, played into the off side
punched from outside off down the on side, wide of the bowler
full and straight, defended into midwicket
flicked off the pads into square leg
goes to pull a slightly shorter delivery, gets a bottom edge into his boot
given a lot of air outside off, driven powerfully into the covers but du Plessis flies to his left to make a diving save
straighter delivery, defended to the leg side
pushed firmly into the off side, can't beat cover

lovely bowling, was that a missed stumping? Russell beaten by one which turned away, the back foot dragged but de Villiers couldn't gather cleanly. He may have made it back as it was quite wide of the stumos
pushed into the off side
whipped from outside off to long on
forward and defended
played off the back foot down to long off
short outside off, Carter onto the back foot but drives straight to mid off
taken from outside off to midwicket
on the back foot again, punched down the ground to long on

dropped, but it would have been a wonderful catch. It was full outside leg, he played a paddle sweep and got a top edge towards short fine leg. Steyn is quite wide in that position but flung himself full stretch to his right and nearly held a blinder
full outside off, 138kph, defended to the off side
nicely bowled, this one nips into Russell on a full length and is defended back to the bowler
back and across, defended straight down the pitch
short of a length outside off, pushed into the off side and finds a gap
driven through the off side to the sweeper
nearly squeezes through, was quite full but Russell was defending on the back foot and gets a thick inside edge into his pads
full on off stump, Carter is well forward as he defends
round the wicket, full outside off, patted into the covers
an attempt at some aggression, aims to sweep this from well outside off but the ball skids under the bat
drives firmly to mid off
goes down early and paddle-sweeps this through short fine leg...Carter appears to like a sweep
nearly a stumping! Carter was beaten by one that spun in past the inside edge, took the pad and rebounded wide of de Villiers which made it very difficult to gather
back of a length outside off, a very neat drive square of the wicket by Russell to beat point
bouncer over off stump, Russell ducks
that's dispatched, dragged down short by Steyn, but not a bouncer, it sat up nicely and Russell pulled it over midwicket off the front foot

good response from Steyn, but it costs him another boundary. Was full outside off, Russell prodded at it but the edge fell well short and wide of Amla at slip and he couldn't get his right hand to the ball
beaten! Lovely bowling. Still a hint of away swing, Russell feeling for it away from his body
slower ball, 116kph, full outside off and defended back to the bowler
round the wicket, deftly dabbed away wide of slip and fine of short third man
another sweep, comes off a fair chunk of top edge but short fine leg is a vacant area
full on the stumps, whipped along the ground through midwicket
a strangled appeal from Tahir as this spins in from outside off, but struck Carter outside off stump and he was playing a shot
good connection! Onto the grass bank at deep midwicket. Full outside off, it was actually a googly so was hitting against the spin but he was fully committed and comfortably cleared the boundary
another googly, defended into the off side...a couple of decent overs for West Indies
good ball, full outside off, Russell doesn't move is feet and fiddles for it...second bounce to de Villiers

heave and a miss! Another West Indies let down by a horrid shot. He was going nicely, then decides to swipe across the line of a length ball which takes the top of leg stump. Where do these shots come from? What is thought process?
excellent bouncer, over off stump, Brathwaite has to jerk his head quickly out of the line
well bowled, goes fuller this time, nips into Brathwaite who defends on the front foot
across onto off stump, defended towards point
nicely flicked away, a full ball angled into leg stump, gets it wide of midwicket...Morkel not thrilled by the fielding and kicks out one of the stumps and flicking off the bails
full outside off, driven to the cover sweeper

given lbw. He went to pull a short ball which skidded on and struck the back leg. Carter reviewed and my gut was that this didn't look out at first glance. Turned a fair bit. Missing leg? Oh, it's clipping leg! The decision will stand.
another appeal, not full-throated this time, as a googly spins into Holder...drifting towards leg
prodded into the off side
shorter delivery, Holder onto the back foot and neatly whipped wide of mid on
full on leg stump, worked to midwicket
full outside off, 134kph, defended to the covers
full and wide outside off, left alone, another one that doesn't reach de Villiers on the full
short outside off, bit of a wasted delivery, Holder can leave it alone
keeps it short outside off, the line isn't quite right, a touch too wide
straightens the line, this nips into Holder from a fuller length and takes him on the pad
short of a length, tucked into the leg side
worked from off stump to midwicket
full and straight, he aims to the leg side and gets a leading edge into the off side but along the ground
drags the length back, this shapes away from the right hander and scoots past the edge
fantastic stroke, he walked at the bowler then flicked a straight delivery wide of mid on with a beautiful piece of timing
batting well outside his crease again, defended to the off side
short delivery, Holder goes for a pull and gets a bottom edge into his body which bobbles to the leg side
pushed square into the off side
lunges forward to a googly, takes bat and pad into the leg side
goes for a sweep, lobs off a mixture of glove, back of bat and pad but is wide of de Villiers
pushed to mid off

bigger appeal! This looked better, another googly which catches him on the crease and this time de Villiers agrees to the review. Has it turned too much? No, it hasn't! It crashes full into the top of leg stump. Good call from captain and bowler
nicely bowled, full on middle, hint of turn and defended to cover
worked off the pads to deep midwicket

and another! Simple stuff from Philander, a straight delivery which nips back a little, perhaps, just keeps a touch low, but Taylor is on the back foot and is struck on the back leg. Hitting middle of middle.
on off stump, defended
pushed up to mid off
good length outside off, edged wide of the lone slip towards third man
short of a length outside off, not far from dragging into the stumps as he gets a bottom edge
pushes forward on off stump, plays towards point
nicely played by Benn, goes inside out over the off side, good placement as he gets it wide of long off...brings up three figures
nice reply, full outside off, beats the outside edge
plays a repeat shot! More terrific placement as he takes advantage of the Powerplay and lofts this over the off side, nice clean striking from Benn
quicker ball, scoots past the edge
googly to end the over, prodded into the off side
shuffles to the leg side, prods at a full-length delivery and gets an inside edge into the pads
short of a length, clubbed over mid on by Holder who spotted the length early even though it was a slower ball which held in the pitch
on leg stump, flicked off the pads to deep square
well bowled, nearly gets through...a full ball which swings back into Benn and he gets an inside edge
massive blow! Over the stands. Benn charges at a length delivery and smites this miles over long on. Not sure we'll get that ball back.
short of a length, on off stump, defended
short of a length on off stump, worked through midwicket...Holder wanted a second but was sent back. Benn fancies it
fishes outside off at a ball angled across, his feet stayed firmly planted around leg stump
short of a length on middle and off, blocked to the off side
squirts off an open face behind point to third man
pulls a short delivery in front of square
full outside off, Holder drives and it slides off the face to third man
driven in the air but finds space through the off side
round the wicket, goes to sweep a full delivery and doesn't make contact
skids under the bottom edge again as he plays another sweep
and that is that...changes down the pitch, head in the air, misses his swing to the leg side and provides an easy stumping chance. A fitting way to end the innings, frankly.

inn2.comm: good length on off stump, played forward and knocked into the covers
tad fuller, ran up towards mid-off
around the wicket, length just outside off, pressed off the back foot through point and the chase is underway
straight line on a length, nudged from the crease back up the wicket
more off stump, Amla back again nudging back to the bowler
fuller and straighter, dug out wide of mid-on
tad short, firmly punched from just outside off wide of mid-off, timed well enough for a couple
fuller length, Amla back to cut and needs fast hands to get onto it, plays out to backward point
touch too wide and flashed through cover, great timing, quick hands again, opens the face to steer it in the gap
better delivery, Amla well forward to block up on the off side
this skids on and beats the flick to leg, struck the pad would have gone down leg
floated up now, driven nicely again from just outside off past extra-cover, not timed perfectly so just a couple
full length on off stump, forward stride to play back to the bowler
back of a length angled in towards off stump, Rossouw back forcing to mid-off's right hand, wide enough for a sharp single
length ball skids on a little and beats Amla trying to flick to leg, like the last over, would have gone down, high too
off stump now, Amla across his stumps playing back to the bowler
forward to a length ball, squirts it out off a thick inside edge through square leg
full angled in, Rossouw just blocks it back to the bowler
length just outside off, Amla hanging back drops it into the covers and they take on Carter for a single and get home comfortably
angled in, Rossouw across his stumps nudging wide of mid-on, another single
shorter length, tried to be flicked to leg, misses, ball pops out on the off side and Rossouw calls a sharp run, good cricket
foot wide of off stump, mistimed punch towards cover and not wide enough of the fielder for a single
straighter line, dropped back up the wicket
touch shorter, rides the bounce and drops this down towards midwicket
length ball on off stump, firm punch from the crease straight to mid-off
straighter line, flicked to short midwicket who saves well going to his right, then throws at the batsman's end and Amla has to scramble back into his ground
too straight and tickled down the leg side, just helped on its way
full just outside off, pushed to cover point
full length, driven off a thick inside edge to the right hand of mid-on
width offered, only a bit but enough, and Amla times a beautiful drive through extra cover
again just a touch wide and crashed through the covers, great timing, zips through the covers
tighter line, played forward and blocked back to the bowler
over the wicket now, length ball just outside off, driven straight to mid-off

back of a length and pulled, total miscue, it goes straight up and taken by mid-off. Wasn't short enough for the pull, Rossouw late on the stroke too and slapped it straight up in the air and an easy catch pouched
bumper, right on line, ducked
wide on the crease, nudged past short long leg and they get a single
back of a length just outside off, Amla through with the back foot drive a little too soon, gets a thick inside edge to mid-on's right
foot wide of off stump, Amla stays leg side of it and crashes to cover
tighter line and just pressed out towards point
straighter, too straight, well-timed flick past midwicket, lovely stroke
back outside off, only just, pressed off the back foot to extra-cover
bumper, Amla takes no chances and gets under it
length ball punched down to long-on
wide on the crease, floated up, across the stumps flicking out through square leg
straighter, knocked down to long-on again
forward press just outside off, plays back to the bowler
fuller length, knocked down to long-on
across the off stump flicking down the ground again
bumper goes over the off stump, ducked
two feet wide of off stump, left alone
length just outside off stump, punched to extra-cover
fuller and driven this time, finds short extra-cover
even fuller, angled out to backward point
shorter and pulled well, short midwicket gets a good hand to it and it's just a single
length a foot outside off, blocked forward out to extra-cover
further outside off and left this time
angles this back into the right-hander who defends back up the wicket
length ball a foot outside off, punched to cover
touch shorter, blocked going across the off stump
fuller and more off stump, knocked out towards point
gorgeous shot, just a tad short and slightly wide of the off stump, no leaving alone for Amla, gets up on his toes and timed a back-foot drive perfectly through the covers
straighter line, timed really well into the leg side this time, finds deep square
length just outside off, blocked up the wicket
shorter, du Plessis drops the hands on it, bounces too high
full length angled at the stumps, worked out wide of long leg and they run well for an easy couple
similar ball, this time du Plessis can't work it away and gets struck on the pad, missing leg
almost exactly the same scenario
back of a length at the body, dropped down through square leg
angled towards off stump, du Plessis angles out to backward point
touch fuller and a tad straighter, touched to midwicket
hint of width and du Plessis leans out to angle down to third man
little straight, touched straight to long leg
also turned to long leg, this from a fuller ball, fifty up
full on middle and leg, du Plessis misses not for the first time with a flick to leg, should be an easy ball to milk that
just outside off and timed from the crease to extra-cover
tighter to off stump and just blocked on this occasion
shorter and pulled, there's a man back at deep square and this is pretty much straight to him but it dies on the fielder and lands just short of his dive
length ball a foot outside off, flashed at and missed
bumper, in the channel outside off, left alone
full just outside off, angled out to backward point
back of a length, a steady pull shot down to long leg
yorker on the stumps, dug out down to long leg
full length on off stump, driven up to mid-on
full length again, a few inches outside off, angled to backward point
good length on a tighter line, pressed forward to short midwicket
forward press from off stump inside mid-on but not enough for a single
length just outside off, handsome back-foot drive straight to extra-cover
tighter line, dropped into point, now Amla's finding the fielders
straighter line, flicked straight to mid-on
back of a length and a brutish pull stroke finds deep square
fuller on the stumps, flicked to mid-on
good length on off stump, blocked forward back to the bowler
too straight and whipped away, picks the gap backward of square, nicely placed
not quite as straight, tucked to midwicket
a little too straight again, tucked straight to long leg this time
full a foot or so outside off, leaned out to and angled down to third man
tighter line to off stump, dropped into the covers, fielder in too soon to allow the single
full length at the off stump, pressed back to the bowler's right hand
a step down the wicket and bunts this right over the bowler's head, timed it perfectly
drifts down leg, a little tickle off the pad, then half-saved by the keeper, around comes long leg to his right to save four
a foot outside off, punched off the back foot to extra-cover
this keeps a touch low just outside off, du Plessis has to adjust and drop the bat on it but managed to time it really well and steered it past short extra-cover, it races away
bumper and ducked, too big
back of a length slower ball outside off, a mistimed cut finds cover point
length on too straight a line, nudged down to long leg, just off the pad in fact
a few inches outside off, du Plessis showing better touch now in just dropping this down to third man, was leaving those a few overs ago
too straight and an easy run is flicked out wide of deep square
again much better from du Plessis, waiting for a length ball in the crease and just dabbing down to third man to rotate the strike from a good ball
good grief Brathwaite has never watched Amla bat before, another one at the pads, flicked out to deep square
also too straifght, also a single out to deep square and the fifty partnership comes up in 76 balls
back of a length just outside off, pressed from the crease but straight to backward point
back of a length at the body, steered very nicely with a short-arm pull wide of long leg, very poor ball
full at the off stump, driven to mid-on
slower ball, just outside off, ran to point
another cutter, this is straighter, turned wide of long leg and running slowly over the ground, they charge back for two, excellent running
full at middle and leg, whipped out to deep square
back of a length just outside off, nicely pushed out in front of cover point, it runs out towards the boundary and they come back for the second

down the track, driven to mid-on and dropped! A total misjudgment from Benn who for some reason went with one hand above his right shoulder and it burst through his hand. He says he didn't pick it up, looked a very lazy effort in the end
length ball dropped down to third man from just outside off
full at the stumps, firm forward defence up to mid-on
slower ball on the stumps, dropped down towards long leg and more good running brings a second run
back of a length at the body, pulled down to deep square where an excellent diving save to his right prevents the boundary
touch short, back pushing out to deep square
again short but again a forcing stroke only finds the sweeper out on the off side
straighter line, forward press back to the bowler
straighter, worked backward of square leg
tossed up, Amla clears the front leg and lifts a drive over extra-cover opening the face, great timing, hundred up
tad short, Amla backs away to free the arms once more and punches this away past extra-cover, along the floor this time, absolutely perfect timing, 27th ODI fifty for Amla in 55 balls
just back in length a inch or so outside off, whacked to cover from the crease
straighter and fuller, pressed up to mid-on
cutter, waited for and nudged up to mid-off this time

short ball, pulled off a big top edge, flies down towards Taylor at long leg, he comes around to his left and drops the chance! Another misjudgement, reaching, diving in the end to his left with two hands and the ball went straight through them and bobbled into the rope
length just outside off, dropped into the gully
slower ball, low full toss, driven straight to mid-off
tad short outside off, cut straight to deep cover
fuller on the leg stump, clipped out to deep midwicket
more middle and off now, forward block back up the wicket
drops the length shorter, Amla cuts wide of the sweeper and they can get back for the second as Russell runs to his left
more air, flicked to mid-on who's a touch deep but still able to save one here
better length and just defended back up the wicket
full on the off stump, driven to mid-on
back of a length, slower ball, picked and pulled through midwicket, well timed, four more
slides into the pads, this is touched down to long leg
length just outside off, careful angled to third man
good length on the stumps, calmly blocked back to the bowler
fuller and driven wide enough of mid-off for a quick single and du Plessis now goes to fifty from 69 balls, he's got much better as this innings has gone on
length on off stump, flicked straight to short midwicket
tossed right up on the stumps, tucked with the angle through square leg
few inches outside off, skids on a little, cut straight to extra-cover
whoops, dragged down, pulled for four backward of square, miserable end to a miserable performance from the West Indies
